arts.ttl: 1-3: Stuttgart win in Mönchengladbach before visiting the Bernabéu
arts.sum: Stuttgart beat Borussia Mönchengladbach away on Bundesliga matchday three before facing the first Champions League group game at the Santiago Bernabéu . Stuttgart took the lead through Deniz Undav in the 21st minute.

arts.ttl: Sport Bild Report: Stuttgart's Diehl suffers dislocated shoulder
arts.sum: VfB Stuttgart attacking prospect Justin Diehl suffered a major injury in a VfB reserve game in the 3. Liga on Saturday afternoon. Germany's main sporting tabloid reports that the 19-year-old dislocated his shoulder and will be out long term.

arts.ttl: 15:30 Kickoffs: Leverkusen back on track, Stuttgart earn first win, Leipzig fail against Union
arts.sum: A highly intriguing set of results in the latest set of Bundesliga 15:30 kickoffs concluded with German European representatives Bayer 04 Leverkusen, VfB Stuttgart, and Eintracht Frankfurt taking all three points from respective opponents Hoffenheim, Gladbach, and Wolfsburg. SC Freiburg were also able to prevail at home over VfL Bochum. In the only match to end in a draw, RB Leipzig and 1. FC Union Berlin played to a 0-0 scoreless stalemate at the Red Bull Arena.

arts.ttl: Gladbach vs. Stuttgart preview: Visitors searching for first league win
arts.sum: Stuttgart will be looking to claim their first win of the season when they travel to Borussia-Park for Saturday’s meeting with Borussia Mönchengladbach.

arts.ttl: Stuttgart extend with prospect Seimen: "The future of the VfB goalkeeping position."
arts.sum: VfB Stuttgart confirmed a contract extension for their preferred "keeper of the future" on Friday.

arts.ttl: Robin Hack on leaving Borussia Mönchengladbach in the summer: “I didn’t come to Gladbach to leave after just one year.”
arts.sum: Speaking to Bild, Borussia Mönchengladbach forward Robin Hack spoke on the rumours surrounding his future this summer. Hack had been linked with VfB Stuttgart as well as Juventus and Bologna which would…

arts.ttl: Hack comments on links to Stuttgart, Juventus and Bologna
arts.sum: Robin Hack has commented on reports suggesting that Stuttgart, Juventus and Bologna showed interest in him during the summer.

arts.ttl: Preview: Borussia Monchengladbach vs. Stuttgart - prediction, team news, lineups
arts.sum: Sports Mole previews Saturday's Bundesliga clash between Borussia Monchengladbach and Stuttgart, including predictions, team news and possible lineups.
